results.title: Lumaaq: an Eskimo legend [English version]
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Pierre Moretti and Co Hoedeman
results.brief_description: Lumaaq tells the story of a legend widely believed by the Povungnituk Innuit. The artist’s drawings are transferred to paper, cut out and animated under the camera. The result is Innuit prints in action. Dialogue, music and artwork make this film a total cultural transplant. Sound film without commentary.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Pierre Moretti and Co Hoedeman

results.title: Lulu on the bridge
results.creator_credit: Redeemable Features, Peter Newman, Greg Johnson, Amy Kaufman and Paul Auster
results.brief_description: Writer Paul Auster made his solo directorial debut with this romantic drama that combines myth and realism in a form of storytelling that is both simple and complex. Izzy Maurer is a jazz saxophonist whose life is permanently changed when he is hit by a stray bullet. After his recovery, Izzy can no longer play and falls into a depression. He stumbles across the body of a stranger and ends up with the dead man’s briefcase. Inside, he discovers a mysterious stone which leads him to Celia Burns, an aspiring actress and listener of his music. Together, they discover the power of the stone and the threat of those who want it, as the story takes a dark and surprising turn into the Pandora’s Box of Izzy’s soul. Cast includes Harvey Keitel, Mira Sorvino, Willem Dafoe, Gina Gershon and Vanessa Redgrave.

results.title: Luke's Party
results.brief_description: A young woman sits herself in front of a video camera to document her struggles as a single mother. By the time she has finished dealing with her bills, her children’s demands, her best friend’s questions and trying to arrange her son’s birthday, we understand only too well how difficult life can be. A very funny and very affectionate look at working class urban life.

results.title: Luke's party
results.creator_credit: AFI [au], Tim Burns and Ros Sultan
results.brief_description: A woman picks up a video camera to make a mock documentary about growing up Aborigine in South Australia. As the camera starts rolling she is continually interrupted by the demands of children, friends, telephone repair people, neighbours, salespeople and representatives of a range of government bureacracies. This delightfully tongue-in-cheek short film makes salient points about the difficulties of maintaining personal dignity in a world of economic and emotional uncertainty. The futililty of her attempt to explain “herself” on camera as the world around her descends into absurd farce satirises the pretend objectivity of most social-realist documentary. Sharp, witty and suprisingly passionate, “Luke’s Party” is an exceptional short Australian film.

results.title: Luigi's ladies
results.creator_credit: Tra La La Films, Patric Juillet and Judy Morris
results.brief_description: Comedy based around the lives of three Sydney women: publisher Sarah (Wendy Hughes); Cee (Sandy Gore), the rejected wife of an academic; and the ever pregnant Jane (Anne Tenney), wife of a philandering wine dealer. The trio of friends meet regularly at the harbourside restaurant run by the diminutive Luigi, who provides them with champagne, fine food and solace as they discuss one another’s mid-life crises in the world of New Age beliefs and the stock market crash. Co-written by actor Judy Morris and Wendy Hughes, this film leaves many comic opportunities underdeveloped, and was criticised at the time of release for the low standard performances by an obviously talented cast.

results.title: Ludovic: visiting Grandpa
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Jean-Jacques Leduc and Co Hoedeman
results.brief_description: Ludovic spends the afternoon with Grandpa on the farm, tending the animals and the garden. Ludovic and his grandfather both miss grandma very much. Although she’s gone, her magic is still around. Direction, animation, script and camera work by Co Hoedeman.

results.title: Ludovic: the snow gift
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, French Program Animation, Youth Studio Program and Therese Descary
results.brief_description: Ludovic, a young teddy bear who lives in a thatched cottage with his family watches the snow outside and dreams of tobogganing with his friends. His parents tell him he is too little, and Ludovic feels lonely, so he invents wonderful games to share with his new found friend, a doll that came to life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, French Program Animation, Youth Studio Program and Therese Descary

results.title: Ludovic: magic in the air
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Jean-Jacques Leduc and Co Hoedeman
results.brief_description: From the much loved series for young children Ludovic, ‘Magic in the air’, tells a story with puppet animation about the magic of new friends. Ludovic happily plays in the playground when another teddy tries to befriend him, or so he thinks until he is knocked to the ground. Ludovic is rescued by a smiling girl teddy. Suddenly their is magic in the air and Ludovic and his new friend find ways to out-smart the bully. The leaves, the trees and even the sand castle help out and soon the bully leaves him alone. But the magic doesn’t stop and soon magic is used to help cheer up the mad and sad bully. Co Hoedeman who animated, directed and co-wrote this animation blends love with wonderment to create an affectionate story about friendship for kids of all ages. Website Link: www.nfbkids.ca/ludovic

results.title: Ludovic: a crocodile in my garden
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, French Program, Animation Youth Studies, Therese Descary, Jean-Jacques Leduc and Co Hoedeman
results.brief_description: Ludovic, a young teddy bear organises his origami jungle animals to go on a spring picnic in his garden. The mood degenerates as the animals disobey Ludovic and fight one another. Ludovic retreats inside disappointed, but all is resolved happily when cookies are distributed and the animals learn to share.

results.title: Lucy, queen of comedy
results.brief_description: Using archival footage, stills, film excerpts and trailers, and television program footage this video puts together an excellent documentary about the career of one of America’s most loved comedic entertainers and actors, Lucille Ball. From radio to motion pictures to eventually television where Lucy, partnered by her husband Desi Arnaz, starred in what is considered America’s all-time favourite television series, “I Love Lucy”. She has also starred with such actors as Eddie Cantor, the Three Stooges, the Marx Brothers, Bob Hope and Henry Fonda. Narrated by Jeff Lupeton.
